page.title: 04Landscape of SW Hamilton
page.content: The area is on a slope from south to north towards the Clyde Valley. The southern half is relatively flat grass land, but as one goes north the ground slopes more and more steeply down towards the river valley (400 feet). All the streams are in steep sided valleys. {ECOLOGY} Most of the area is farmed but the remains of industrial activity (mining) can still be seen in many places. The disused Hamilton-Strathaven railway has been either infilled or converted to a path. The last big spoil heap (Eddlewood Colliery) is being removed at present, but Cadzow Colliery spoil heap has been reclaimed.
